title.narrative: Releasing ERW-Contaminated Land to Enable Development and Enhance Human Safety in Laos

description.narrative: Under this project, MAG will support the completion of the national survey by contributing to the defining of all known areas of cluster munition contamination in one of the most heavily contaminated provinces in the country, Xieng Khouang. In order to survey all designated areas of the province within four years MAG is proposing the deployment of the following capacity: 20 MATs focusing on Technical Survey for 45 months and one MAT for 3 additional months; one Community Liaison Team (CLT) for 22 months and one CLT for 26 months to conduct NTS, post- survey education and post-clearance impact assessments; 2 Mechanical Support Units (MSUs) for 48 months; 4 MATs focusing on high priority clearance tasks and roving EOD tasks for 45 months and 23 MATs for 3 months; 2 Quality Management Teams (QMTs) for 48 months. By the end of 2021, it is anticipated that MAG will have achieved the following: NTS will have been concluded in 207 villages; TS will have been conducted on 482,000,000 m2 of land across 416 priority villages; clearance and handover of 5,661,000m2 of land; 100% of Dangerous Area (DA) reports responded to (gathered through NTS and the UXO hotline).

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
